definitions.text: a grammatical category of verbs used to express distinctions of time
become stretched or tense or taut
examples: the rope strained when the weight was attached
alternately relax and tense your calf muscle
tense the rope manually before tensing the spring
He tensed up when he saw his opponent enter the room

definitions.text: cause to be tense and uneasy or nervous or anxious
examples: he got a phone call from his lawyer that tensed him up

definitions.text: in or of a state of physical or nervous tension
pronounced with relatively tense tongue muscles (e.g., the vowel sound in `beat')
